channel.title: 人工智能 - Telegram 频道
channel.description: 我让每个人都能轻松使用人工智能，这样您就可以从零努力开始。💡人工智能💡机器学习💡深度学习💡数据科学💡Python + R💡AR和VR#Courses #Research_Papers #Ebook#News-letterDm @Aiindian - Made with RSSHub 的爱(https://github.com/DIYgod/RSSHub)

item.title: Google 已创建包含 9 门免费课程的生成式 AI 学习路径！涵盖的主题： - LLM 简介 - 注意力机制 - 图像生成/字幕...
行业数据科学与学术界数据科学比较学术界的数据科学和工业界的数据科学就像比较网球和桌十……

description.p:
工业数据科学与学术数据科学
比较学术界的数据科学和工业界的数据科学就像比较网球和乒乓球：它们听起来很相似，但最终，他们是完全不同的！
数据科学在学术界和工业界的 5 大差异 👇：
1️⃣ 模型 vs 数据：学术界重模型，工业界重数据。在学术界，一切都是为了找到最佳模型架构来优化定义的指标。在工业中，加载和处理数据约占工作的 80%。
2️⃣ 新颖性 vs 效率：学术界的最终目标通常是发表论文，而要做到这一点，您需要找到并实施一部小说方法。工业就是效率：尽可能重用现有模型并将它们应用到您的用例中。
3️⃣ 复杂 vs 简单：学术界通常需要复杂的解决方案。我知道情况并非总是如此，但不幸的是，复杂的论文更有可能被顶级会议接受。在工业界，一切都是为了简单：试图找到解决特定问题的最简单的解决方案。
4️⃣ 理论与工程：要在学术界取得成功，您需要具备强大的理论和数学技能。要在行业中取得成功，您需要培养强大的工程技能。能够在 notebook 中训练模型很棒，但如果您不能在生产中部署您的模型，它将完全无用。
5️⃣ 知识影响 vs 美元影响：在学术界，一切都与创造新工作和扩展人类知识有关。在行业中，一切都是关于使用数据来驱动价值和增加收入。 （学分：未知）
还有什么遗漏吗？让我知道

item.title: 🎬 使用 Chatgpt 准备 PowerPoint 演示文稿 🖥 提示：“我希望你为我编写有关历史的 PowerPoint 演示文稿的 VBA 代码......

item.title: 🎬 Adob​​e 在 Photoshop 中引入了生成式 AI 填充！ 🔥 现在是测试版应用程序，可以释放您的想象力，因为您可以生成非凡的图像...

description.p:
Adobe 在 Photoshop 中引入生成式 AI 填充！ 🔥
它现在是一个测试版应用程序，可以释放您的想象力，因为您可以通过简单的文本提示生成非凡的图像。
唯一的限制是我们用这些泛滥的 AI 应用程序创建精美图像的想象力。 🤘

item.title: 🎬 Photoshop 完成了吗？ 🏌 想象一下能够完全按照您想要的方式完善任何图片。现在使用这个 AI 就像拖放一样简单：...

description.p:
Photoshop 完成了吗？ 🏌
想象一下，能够按照您想要的方式完善任何图片。
现在使用这个 AI 就像拖放一样简单：
马克斯普朗克信息学研究所、麻省理工学院和谷歌的研究人员开发了 DragGAN。
</ b>
它可以让您将图片的任何部分“拖动”到您想要的位置。
DragGAN 有 2 个主要部分：
• 运动监督——这可以指导重点你正在向目标位置移动
• 点跟踪——这使用特殊功能来关注你正在移动的点
这意味着它可以做出真正逼真的改变，即使是困难的任务，例如创建图像的隐藏部分或改变形状，同时保持它们看起来自然。
Photoshop 通常需要复杂的技能和知识，而 DragGAN 使复杂的编辑变得像拖放一样简单。
br />虽然 DragGAN 擅长精确的图像变形，但我仍然觉得 Photoshop 的综合图形设计工具具有价值。
代码：https://github.com/XingangPan/DragGAN
论文：https://huggingface.co/papers/2305.10973

item.title: 🎬 比尔盖茨和苏格拉底使用 AI 产生了关于 AI 本身的好处和威胁的辩论。

description.p: 比尔·盖茨和苏格拉底使用人工智能引发了关于人工智能本身的好处和威胁的辩论。

item.title: 🖼“人工智能教父”离开谷歌并警告前方危险

description.p:
“人工智能教父”离开谷歌并警告前方危险
辛顿表示，他已经辞去了在谷歌工作了十多年的工作，成为该领域最受尊敬的声音之一，因此他可以畅所欲言地谈论 AI 的风险。他说，他的一部分现在后悔自己一生的工作。
“我用通常的借口安慰自己：如果我没有做，其他人就会做，”欣顿在一段很长的时间里说上周在他多伦多家中的餐厅接受采访。
但是困扰着许多业内人士的是一种恐惧，即他们正在向野外释放一些危险的东西。生成式人工智能已经可以成为错误信息的工具。很快，这可能会对工作构成威胁。科技界最大的担忧者表示，未来某处，这可能会给人类带来风险。
“很难看出如何防止坏人利用它做坏事。”

item.title: Meta Ai 刚刚发布了“DINOv2：在没有监督的情况下学习强大的视觉特征” ✅ 模型在 1.42 亿张图像上进行了自我监督的预训练......

description.p:
Meta Ai 刚刚发布“DINOv2: Learning Robust Visual Features without Supervision”
✅模型已预训练以自我监督的方式对 1.42 亿张图像进行处理，即没有任何标签
✅模型特征可以直接与分类器一起使用，无需微调以提供强大的性能
✅ 从模型中提取的视觉特征可用于深度估计、语义分割、实例检索等各种任务
✅ 模型是开源的
推荐查看Demo： https://dinov2.metademolab.com/demos
Github：https ://github.com/facebookresearch/dinov2
博客：https://ai.facebook.com/blog/dino-v2-computer-vision-self-supervised-learning/
论文：< a href="https://arxiv.org/pdf/2304.07193.pdf" rel="noopener" target="_blank">https://arxiv.org/pdf/2304.07193.pdf

item.title: 比尔·盖茨 (Bill Gates) 刚刚发表了一封长达 7 页的关于 AI 及其未来预测的信 这是摘要：✔️AI 在未来 5-10 年的影响：-Chan...

description.p:
比尔·盖茨 (Bill Gates) 刚刚发表了一封长达 7 页的关于人工智能及其未来预测的信
摘要如下：
✔️人工智能在未来 5-10 年的影响：
-改变人们工作、学习、旅行、获得医疗保健和沟通的方式，
-影响整个行业
br />✔️人工智能在减少全球不平等方面的潜力：
-健康：拯救贫穷国家儿童的生命
-教育：提高数学技能，尤其是弱势学生
-气候变化：帮助解决世界上最贫困人口面临的问题
✔️工作场所的人工智能集成：
-提高生产力和效率
-支持创建个人代理和公司范围的代理
✔️人工智能在医疗保健中的应用：
-协助医护人员完成任务和文书工作
-改善贫穷国家获得医疗建议和治疗的机会
-通过分析复杂的生物数据加速医学突破
-激励公司分享 AI 生成的见解贫穷国家的农业
-人工智能可以改良种子、为农民提供建议并开发牲畜药物
-人工智能驱动的软件将在未来 5-10 年内彻底改变教育
-人工智能可以帮助教师和管理者以各种方式
-确保人工智能工具可用于低收入学校并解决数字鸿沟
-解决人工智能的风险和问题，包括上下文理解和-抽象推理
-政府和私营部门应合作限制人工智能风险
-超级智能人工智能提出有关目标和与人类潜在冲突的问题
-人工智能进步将带来新的硬件、软件和应用程序
-平衡AI 的缺点及其改善生活的潜力
政府和慈善机构应确保 AI 减少不平等
随着技术的进步，当今 AI 的局限性将被克服
点击此处阅读更多内容：
https://www.gatesnotes.com/The-人工智能时代已经开始

b.a: 人工智能时代已经开始

blockquote.p: 比尔·盖茨解释了为什么人工智能与个人电脑、手机一样具有革命性, 和互联网，他给出了如何思考它的三个原则。 wjX3EyA3cs6Vw3Dksoj6-q81yNLOUXKhHUNNQIS8yb5QsLl6cXR06UmSh12BehGUllHJLi_DLF9LL6VP8j8GjpTyaG0D1QrzfqS7mFXNO4oYXVkCF9w_cl0inSD9XAwIYkVI2bRtLSQX8x2 5cqnuCKGzuH3lzuY05iAYCwcnmkgnEv6zJ8qLEJWLA9qyy1YylHWUwrXj7U6RjbetNKr8nYwTpZ-trIOzTDApWrEZhc04j82KMLE_xReDWRVhUk9xQ。 jpg" />

item.title: ChatGPT 可以比许多程序员更快地编写代码并且看起来更好。那么它会很快取代软件工程师吗？答案是否定的。这里...

description.p:
ChatGPT 可以比许多程序员更快地编写代码，而且看起来比许多程序员更好。
那么它会很快取代软件工程师吗？
答案是否定的。
这里有4个原因：👇
1）目前，在做编程任务时，ChatGPT输出代码。每个人都能理解、操纵和使用代码吗？不——只有软件工程师才是。 ChatGPT 当前与编码相关的输出对一般人群无用，需要由 SWE 处理。
2) ChatGPT 已被证明有时会给出错误的答案，包括错误代码。任何健全的企业都不会冒险摆脱他们的 SWE，转而支持可以证明编写有缺陷软件的 AI。
3) ChatGPT 目前正在努力成功调试有缺陷的代码，即使是在简单、独立的代码块中也是如此.我们可以想象，这在大型、复杂的代码库中尤其如此。如果您需要 SWE 来调试您的 AI 代码，您就无法摆脱它们。
4) 要使用 ChatGPT 构建复杂的应用程序，您需要给它提供复杂的提示，这本身也需要一些技术知识作为“及时工程”的实力。目前，SWE 是编写这些提示的最有能力的人。
ChatGPT 不会取代软件工程师，而是为他们提供令人惊叹的生活质量改善工具，帮助他们执行某些操作编程任务快得多。
如果您是 SWE，则暂时不必担心 ChatGPT。 （学分：未知）

item.title: 🖼 ChatDoctor：使用医学领域知识在 LLaMA 上微调的医学聊天模型。收集了大约 700 种疾病的数据并生成了 5K 名医生...

item.title: Google has created Generative AI learning path with 9 FREE courses! Topics covered: - Intro to LLMs - Attention Mechanism - Image Generation/Captionin...

description.p:
Google has created Generative AI learning path with 9 FREE courses!
Topics covered:
- Intro to LLMs
- Attention Mechanism
- Image Generation/Captioning
- Intro to Responsible AI
From the fundamentals of LLMs to creating & deploying generative AI solutions! 🚀
1️⃣ Introduction to Generative AI:
An introductory level micro-learning course aimed at explaining:
- What Generative AI is
- How it is used
- How it differs from traditional ML
Check this out👇
https://www.cloudskillsboost.google/course_templates/536
2️⃣ Introduction to Large Language Models:
The course explores:
- Fundamentals LLMs
- Their use cases
- Prompt engineering on LLMs
Check this out👇
https://www.cloudskillsboost.google/course_templates/539
3️⃣ Introduction to Responsible AI:
The course explains what responsible AI is, why it's important, and how Google implements responsible AI in their products.
Check this out👇
https://www.cloudskillsboost.google/course_templates/554
4️⃣ Introduction to Image Generation:
This course introduces diffusion models, a family of ML models that recently showed promise in the image generation space.
Check this out👇
https://www.cloudskillsboost.google/course_templates/541
5️⃣ Encoder-Decoder Architecture:
This course gives you a synopsis of the encoder-decoder architecture.
It's a powerful and prevalent machine learning architecture for sequence-to-sequence tasks.
Check this out👇
https://www.cloudskillsboost.google/course_templates/543
6️⃣ Attention Mechanism:
The course teaches you how attention works & how it revolutionised:
- machine translation
- text summarisation
- question answering
Check this out👇
https://www.cloudskillsboost.google/course_templates/537
7️⃣ Transformer Models and BERT Model:
This course introduces you to some of the most famous and effective transformer architectures!
Check this out👇
https://www.cloudskillsboost.google/course_templates/538
8️⃣ Create Image Captioning Models:
This course teaches you how to create an image captioning model by using deep learning.
Check this out👇
https://www.cloudskillsboost.google/course_templates/542
9️⃣ Introduction to Generative AI Studio:
This course introduces Generative AI Studio, a product on Vertex AI.
It teaches you to prototype and customize generative AI models so you can use their capabilities in your applications.
Check this out👇
https://www.cloudskillsboost.google/course_templates/552
Bonus: ⭐️
https://cloud.google.com/blog/topics/training-certifications/new-google-cloud-generative-ai-training-resources

b.a: Generative AI learning path | Google Cloud Skills Boost

blockquote.p: This learning path guides you through a curated collection of content on generative AI products and technologies, from the fundamentals of Large Language Models to how to create and deploy generative AI solutions on Google Cloud.

item.title: Industry Data Science vs Academia Data Science Comparing Data Science in academia and Data Science in industry is like comparing tennis with table ten...

description.p:
Industry Data Science vs Academia Data Science
Comparing Data Science in academia and Data Science in industry is like comparing tennis with table tennis: they sound similar but in the end, they are completely different!
5 big differences between Data Science in academia and in industry 👇:
1️⃣ Model vs Data: Academia focuses on models, industry focuses on data. In academia, it’s all about trying to find the best model architecture to optimise a defined metric. In industry, loading and processing the data accounts for around 80% of the job.
2️⃣ Novelty vs Efficiency: The end goal of academia is often to publish a paper and to do so, you will need to find and implement a novel approach. Industry is all about efficiency: reusing existing models as much as possible and applying them to your use case.
3️⃣ Complex vs Simple: More often than not, academia requires complex solutions. I know that this isn’t always the case but unfortunately, complex papers get a higher chance of being accepted at top conferences. In industry, it’s all about simplicity: trying to find the simplest solution that solves a specific problem.
4️⃣ Theory vs Engineering: To succeed in academia, you need to have strong theoretical and maths skills. To succeed in industry, you need to develop strong engineering skills. It is great to be able to train a model in a notebook but if you cannot deploy your model in production, it will be completely useless.
5️⃣ Knowledge impact vs $ impact: In academia, it’s all about creating new work and expanding human knowledge. In industry, it is all about using data to drive value and increase revenue. (credits: unknown)
Anything else missing? Let me know

item.title: 🎬 Photoshop is finished? 🏌 Imagine being able to perfect any picture exactly how you want it. Now it's as simple as drag and drop with this AI: ...

description.p:
Photoshop is finished? 🏌
Imagine being able to perfect any picture exactly how you want it.
Now it's as simple as drag and drop with this AI:
Researchers from Max Planck Institute for Informatics, MIT and Google have developed DragGAN.
It lets you 'drag' any part of a picture to exactly where you want it.
DragGAN has 2 main parts:
• Motion supervision — this guides the point you're moving towards the target position
• Point tracking — this uses special features to keep an eye on the point you're moving
This means it can make really realistic changes, even for difficult tasks like creating hidden parts of images or changing shapes while keeping them looking natural.
Where Photoshop often requires intricate skill and knowledge, DragGAN makes complex edits as simple as drag and drop.
While DragGAN excels at precise image deformation, I still feel Photoshop's comprehensive tools for graphic design hold value.
Code: https://github.com/XingangPan/DragGAN
Paper: https://huggingface.co/papers/2305.10973

item.title: 🖼 ‘The godfather of AI’ Leaves Google and warns of danger ahead Hinton said he has quit his job at Google, where he has worked for more than deca...

description.p:
‘The godfather of AI’ Leaves Google and warns of danger ahead
Hinton said he has quit his job at Google, where he has worked for more than decade and became one of the most respected voices in the field, so he can freely speak out about the risks of AI. A part of him, he said, now regrets his life’s work.
“I console myself with the normal excuse: If I hadn’t done it, somebody else would have,” Hinton said during a lengthy interview last week in the dining room of his home in Toronto.
But gnawing at many industry insiders is a fear that they are releasing something dangerous into the wild. Generative AI can already be a tool for misinformation. Soon, it could be a risk to jobs. Somewhere down the line, tech’s biggest worriers say, it could be a risk to humanity.
“It is hard to see how you can prevent the bad actors from using it for bad things.”

item.title: Meta Ai Just released "DINOv2: Learning Robust Visual Features without Supervision" ✅ Models were pre-trained on 142 Million images in self-supervise...

description.p:
Meta Ai Just released "DINOv2: Learning Robust Visual Features without Supervision"
✅ Models were pre-trained on 142 Million images in self-supervised fashion i.e. without any labels
✅ Model features can be used with classifiers directly without fine-tuning to deliver strong performance
✅ Visual features extracted from the models can be used for a variety of tasks like depth estimation, semantic segmentation, instance retrieval etc
✅ Models are open-sourced
Recommended to check Demo: https://dinov2.metademolab.com/demos
Github: https://github.com/facebookresearch/dinov2
Blog: https://ai.facebook.com/blog/dino-v2-computer-vision-self-supervised-learning/
Paper: https://arxiv.org/pdf/2304.07193.pdf

item.title: Bill Gates just published a 7-page letter about AI and his predictions for its future Here is the summary: ✔️AI impact in the next 5-10 years: -Chan...

description.p:
Bill Gates just published a 7-page letter about AI and his predictions for its future
Here is the summary:
✔️AI impact in the next 5-10 years:
-Change how people work, learn, travel, access healthcare, and communicate,
-Influence entire industries
✔️AI's potential for reducing global inequities:
-Health: save lives of children in poor countries
-Education: improve math skills, particularly for disadvantaged students
-Climate change: help address issues faced by the world's poorest
✔️AI integration in the workplace:
-Enhance productivity and efficiency
-Support the creation of personal agents and company-wide agents
✔️AI applications in healthcare:
-Assist healthcare workers with tasks and paperwork
-Improve access to medical advice and treatment in poor countries
-Accelerate medical breakthroughs by analyzing complex biological data
-Incentivize companies to share AI-generated insights for agriculture in poor countries
-AI can improve seeds, advise farmers, and develop drugs for livestock
-AI-driven software will revolutionize education in the next 5-10 years
-AI can assist teachers and administrators in various ways
-Ensure AI tools are available for low-income schools and address the digital divide
-Address risks and problems with AI, including context understanding and -abstract reasoning
-Governments and the private sector should collaborate to limit AI risks
-Super intelligent AIs raise questions about goals and potential conflict with humanity
-AI advancements will lead to new hardware, software, and applications
-Balance AI's downsides with its potential to improve lives
Governments and philanthropy should ensure AI reduces inequity
AI limitations today will be overcome as the technology advances
Read more here:
https://www.gatesnotes.com/The-Age-of-AI-Has-Begun

b.a: The Age of AI has begun

blockquote.p: Bill Gates explains why AI is as revolutionary as personal computers, mobile phones, and the Internet, and he gives three principles for how to think about it.

item.title: ChatGPT can write code faster and seemingly better than many programmers. So will it replace software engineers anytime soon? The answer is No. Here a...

description.p:
ChatGPT can write code faster and seemingly better than many programmers.
So will it replace software engineers anytime soon?
The answer is No.
Here are 4 reasons why: 👇
1) Currently, when doing programming tasks, ChatGPT outputs code. And is everybody able to grok, manipulate, and use code? No—only software engineers are. ChatGPT's current coding-related outputs are useless to the general population and need to be handled by SWEs.
2) ChatGPT has been proven to sometimes give incorrect answers, including buggy code. No sound business will risk getting rid of their SWEs in favor of an AI that can provably write buggy software.
3) ChatGPT currently struggles to successfully debug buggy code, even in simple, self-contained code blocks. We can imagine that this will remain especially true in large, complex codebases. You can't get rid of SWEs if you need them to debug your AI's code.
4) To build complex applications with ChatGPT, you need to give it complex prompts that inherently require some technical knowledge as well as "prompt engineering" prowess. Right now, SWEs are the best-equipped people to write these prompts.
Instead of replacing software engineers, ChatGPT will serve as an amazing quality-of-life-improvement tool for them, helping them perform certain programming tasks much faster.
If you're a SWE, you don't need to worry about ChatGPT—for now. (Credits: Unknown)

description.div:
ChatDoctor: A medical chat model fine-tuned on LLaMA using medical domain knowledge.
Collects data on around 700 diseases and generated 5K doctor-patient conversations to finetune the LLM.

Paper: arxiv.org/abs/2303.14070
